summary: The Youth Mental Health Research Act (S. 1266) proposes a Youth Mental Health Research Initiative within the National Institutes of Health. Led by the Director of the National Institute of Mental Health, the initiative will encourage collaborative research across institutes focusing on youth mental health. This research aims to boost community resilience, improve intervention delivery, and addresses social, behavioral, and cognitive aspects. The bill authorizes $100 million annually for fiscal years 2025-2030 for this program.
